page.description: Skip over a pattern . Returns number of characters skipped.
page.syntax: Chars_Skipped as N = SkipOverSmatchI as n(pattern as c)

argument.name: Chars_Skipped
argument.description: The number of characters the offset has been moved.

argument.name: pattern
argument.description: The text to find in the buffer. You may use the "?" (single character) and "*" (any number of characters) expressions.

page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.SkipOverSmatchI() function moves the offset to the first position after the specified Find_Text (case insensitive) and returns the number of characters that the offset has moved. The offset does not move if it is already pointing to the specified text.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is wonderful text written by a great writer %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.SkipOverSmatchI("Th*w") = 9 ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is w" ? scanner.getremainder() = onderful text written by a great writer
